datasource: Brandeis Now Brandeis Now 2010-12-06 17:20:00 'Small Act' discussion focuses on unlikely givers Chris Mburu was a child living in a village in Kenya when he first received a $15 scholarship from a Swedish woman. Her humble but steady sponsorship put Chris through school and eventually launched him into Harvard Law School, paving the way to his job as a United Nations attorney focused on human rights, anti-discrimination, and genocide. http://www.brandeis.edu/now/2010/december/smallacttalk.html
